tuv.seg: Before you come to Ireland
Sula dtagann tú go hÉirinn
There are many reasons why you may be coming to Ireland
Is iomaí cúis a d'fhéadfadh a bheith agat le teacht go hÉirinn
You may be coming to work, to set up a business, to study, to join a family member or to retire
B'fhéidir go bhfuil tú ag teacht le dul ag obair, le gnólacht a bhunú, le bheith in éineacht le duine muinteartha nó le dul ar scor
You may be looking for international protection and intend to apply for refugee status or subsidiary protection
B'fhéidir go bhfuil tú ag lorg cosanta agus go bhfuil sé i gceist agat cur isteach ar stádas dídeanaithe nó ar chosaint eile
Before you come to Ireland, you need to know first of all whether or not you are entitled to live here
Sula dtiocfaidh tú go hÉirinn, ní mór duit a fháil amach an bhfuil tú i dteideal cónaí anseo nó nach bhfuil
Your right to live in Ireland depends mainly on your nationality and what you intend to do when you come here
Braitheann do cheart cónaithe in Éirinn go príomha ar do náisiúntacht agus ar a bhfuil sé i gceist agat a dhéanamh nuair a thagann tú anseo
After you have established whether or not you are entitled to come and live in Ireland, you will need other information about the formalities of living here
Tar éis duit a dhearbhú an bhfuil sé de chead agat teacht chun cónaí in Éirinn nó nach bhfuil, beidh eolas eile ag teastáil uait maidir leis na gnásanna a bhaineann le cónaí anseo
This document is an overview of the main things you need to know if you are proposing to come to Ireland to live
Is forbhreathnú é an doiciméad seo ar na príomhnithe le bheith ar eolas agat má tá sé i gceist agat cur fút in Éirinn
(It is not designed for short term visitors, but you may find some relevant information below.)
(Níl sé dírithe ar chuairteoirí gearrthréimhseacha, ach d'fhéadfá roinnt eolais ábhartha a aimsiú thíos.)
Coming to Ireland and permission to enter
Teacht go hÉirinn agus cead isteach
There are some general rules which apply regardless of the reason why you are coming to Ireland
Tá roinnt rialacha ginearálta i bhfeidhm gan aird ar an gcúis atá agat teacht go hÉirinn
EEA and Switzerland: In general, nationals of EEA countries or Switzerland, have the right to enter Ireland (subject to some narrow restrictions)
AE/LEE/An Eilvéis: Go ginearálta, tá cead isteach go hÉirinn ag náisiúnaigh de bhallstáit an AE, de thíortha eile an LEE nó ón Eilvéis, (faoi réir roinnt srianta cúnga)
You do not need a visa but you will need a valid passport or identity card in order to land
Níl víosa ag teastáil uait ach beidh pas nó cárta aitheantais bailí ag teastáil uait le teacht isteach
You are generally entitled to take up residence in Ireland if you are employed or self-employed
Go ginearálta, tá tú i dteideal cónaí in Éirinn má tá tú fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe
You are entitled to come here to study or retire here if you meet certain conditions
Tá tú i dteideal teacht anseo le staidéar a dhéanamh nó le dul ar scor anseo má chomhlíonann tú coinníollacha áirithe
Other countries: Nationals of other countries need permission to enter in Ireland and require permission to remain here
Tíortha eile: Tá cead isteach go hÉirinn agus cead chun fanacht anseo ag teastáil ó náisiúnaigh de thíortha eile
(This doesn't apply if you are a family member of an EEA or a Swiss national who is exercising the right of free movement
(Ní bhaineann seo más duine muinteartha thú de náisiúnach ón AE/LEE/Eilvéis atá ag cleachtadh cheart na saorghluaiseachta
You must however get a residence card.)
Ní mór duit cárta cónaithe a fháil áfach.)
Coming to Ireland to work
Teacht go hÉirinn le dul ag obair
Your right to work as an employee, to be self-employed or set up a business in Ireland depends on your nationality and a number of other factors
Braitheann do cheart chun oibre mar fhostaí, do cheart a bheith féinfhostaithe nó do cheart gnólacht a bhunú in Éirinn ar do náisiúntacht agus ar roinnt tosca eile
You can find out about jobs in Ireland from a number of sources
Is féidir leat eolas a fháil ar phoist in Éirinn ó roinnt foinsí
If you are starting work you will need information on issues such as tax and social insurance contributions
Má tá tú ag tosú ar obair beidh eolas ag teastáil uait ar chúrsaí cánach agus ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh
EEA and Swiss nationals have the right to live, work or set up a business in Ireland
Tá sé de chead ag náisiúnaigh ón AE/LEE/Eilvéis cónaí, obair nó gnólacht a bhunú in Éirinn
You do not need an employment permit
Níl cead fostaíochta ag teastáil uait
You are entitled to be treated in the same way as Irish workers
Tá tú i dteideal go gcaitear leat ar an gcaoi chéanna le hoibrithe ó Éirinn
You are entitled to have family members come with you to Ireland
Tá baill do theaghlaigh i dteideal teacht go hÉirinn leat
Other countries: If you are from outside the EEA or Switzerland you may need a visa in order to come here
Tíortha eile: Murar as an AE/LEE nó an Eilvéis thú, d'fhéadfadh go mbeadh víosa ag teastáil uait le teacht anseo
You need an employment permit in order to work or permission to set up a business here
Tá cead fostaíochta ag teastáil uait le dul ag obair nó cead chun gnólacht a bhunú anseo
You can find out about the different types of employment permit if you are coming to work in Ireland
Is féidir leat eolas a fháil ar na cineálacha éagsúla de cheadanna fostaíochta má tá tú ag teacht le dul ag obair in Éirinn
Your entitlement to have family members come to join you in Ireland depends on the type of employment permit you have
Tá do theidlíocht i dtaobh bhaill do theaghlaigh ag teacht go hÉirinn le bheith leat ag brath ar an gcineál cead fostaíochta atá agat
Coming to Ireland to study
Teacht go hÉirinn le dul ag staidéar
If you intend to come to Ireland to study, you must get a place in an Irish educational institution
Má tá sé i gceist agat teacht go hÉirinn le dul ag staidéar, ní mór duit áit a fháil in institiúid oideachais in Éirinn
There is further information on the education system at primary, secondary and third level
Tá tuilleadh eolais le fáil anseo ar an gcóras oideachais ag leibhéal na bunscoile, na meánscoile agus ag an tríú leibhéal
If you are moving to Ireland for third-level education you can find out about the allocation of third-level places. You can read more about immigrations rules for full-time non-EEA students
Má tá tú ag teacht go hÉirinn le haghaidh oideachais tríú leibhéal is féidir leat eolas a fháil maidir le leithdháileadh na n-áiteanna tríú leibhéal
In general, universities and other third-level colleges charge higher fees to students from outside the EEA and Switzerland
Go ginearálta, gearrann ollscoileanna agus coláistí tríú leibhéal eile táillí níos airde ar mhic léinn nach as an LEE nó an Eilvéis dóibh
Coming to Ireland to retire
Teacht go hÉirinn le dul ar scor
You can find out general information on in our document about retiring to Ireland
Is féidir leat eolas ginearálta a fháil ar theacht ar scor go hÉirinn
Coming to Ireland to seek international protection
Teacht go hÉirinn chun cosaint a lorg
Seeking protection generally means applying for refugee status or subsidiary protection but, if you are refused this, you may apply for permission to remain
Is éard is ciall le cosaint a lorg go hiondúil ná cur isteach ar stádas dídeanaithe ach, má dhiúltaítear dó seo, is féidir leat cur isteach ar chead chun fanacht
EEA nationals are not entitled to seek protection in Ireland
Níl náisiúnaigh ón AE i dteideal cosaint a lorg in Éirinn
If you are seeking protection you must be allowed to land in Ireland
Má tá cosaint á lorg agat caithfidh go ligfear isteach go hÉirinn thú
You can find out more about the asylum process and the services available to asylum seekers
Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil ar an bpróiseas tearmainn agus ar na seirbhísí atá ar fáil don lucht iarrtha tearmainn
You may be a Programme refugee
D'fhéadfaí go mbeifeá i do dhídeanaí cláir
This means that you come to Ireland as part of an organised group and have refugee status
Is éard is ciall leis seo ná gur tháinig tú go hÉirinn mar chuid de ghrúpa eagraithe agus go gcaitear leat mar dhídeanaí
You do not have to go through the normal applications process and you are entitled to work once you arrive in Ireland
Ní bhíonn ort dul tríd an ngnáthphróiseas iarratais agus bíonn tú i dteideal dul ag obair chomh luath is a thagann tú go hÉirinn
General information about living in Ireland
Eolas ginearálta maidir le cónaí in Éirinn
Government: Ireland is a parliamentary democracy
Rialtas: Is daonlathas parlaiminteach atá i bhfeidhm in Éirinn
All residents have the right to vote in local elections and EU citizens also have the right to vote in European elections
Tá cead vótála i dtoghcháin áitiúla ag gach cónaitheoir, agus ina theannta sin tá cead vótála i dtoghcháin Eorpacha ag saoránaigh den AE
UK citizens have the right to vote in national elections as well
Tá cead vótála i dtoghcháin náisiúnta ag saoránaigh den Ríocht Aontaithe freisin
You can find out further information about the national government and local government
Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil ar Rialtas náisiúnta na hÉireann agus ar rialtas áitiúil
Tax and social insurance contributions: If you are working or self-employed you are obliged to pay PRSI contributions in the same way as Irish people
Cáin agus ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh: Má tá tú ag obair nó féinfhostaithe, ní mór duit ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC a íoc mar a dhéanann Éireannaigh
If you are resident in Ireland, you may be liable for income tax and for capital taxes
Go ginearálta, má tá tú i do chónaí in Éirinn, d'fhéadfá a bheith faoi dhliteanas maidir le cáin ioncaim agus le cánacha caipitil
There are specific rules about residency for tax purposes
Tá rialacha sainiúla ann maidir le cónaitheacht i dtaobh cúinsí cánach
Education: Free primary education and secondary education is available to all children aged under 18 legally resident in Ireland
Oideachas: Tá bunoideachas agus meánoideachas saor in aisce ar fáil do gach páiste (faoi bhun 18 mbliana d'aois) atá ina chónaí do dlíthiúil in Éirinn
There are also some fee-paying primary and secondary schools available
Tá roinnt bunscoileanna agus meánscoileanna táille ann freisin
School attendance is obligatory until the age 16
Tá freastal ar an scoil riachtanach go dtí 16 bliana d'aois
Equality: Ireland has equality legislation that prohibits discrimination in employment and access to services on a number of grounds including nationality and racial origin

Comhionannas: Tá reachtaíocht chomhionannais i bhfeidhm in Éirinn a chuireann cosc ar leithcheal i bhfostaíocht agus i rochtain ar sheirbhísí ar fhorais éagsúla lena n-áirítear náisiúntacht agus bunadh cine
Housing: You are likely to find that housing is expensive
Tithíocht: Is dóigh go gceapfaidh tú go bhfuil tithíocht costasach
Some people live in owner-occupied private housing while a number live in private rented accommodation
Tá an chuid is mó de dhaoine ina gcónaí i dtithíocht phríobháideach úinéir-áitithe agus tá go leor daoine ina gcónaí i gcóiríocht phríobháideach ar cíos
Social housing is available but you generally need to have been resident in Ireland for a period of time before you become eligible for it
Tá tithíocht shóisialta inacmhainne ar fáil ach go hiondúil ní mór duit a bheith i do chónaí in Éirinn ar feadh tréimhse sula mbeidh tú incháilithe lena haghaidh
Health services: If you are ordinarily resident in Ireland, you may be entitled to a range of health services that are either free of charge or subsidised by the Government
Seirbhísí sláinte: Má tá tú i do ghnáthchónaí in Éirinn, d'fhéadfaí go mbeifeá i dteideal réimse de sheirbhísí sláinte atá saor in aisce nó atá fóirdheonaithe ag an Rialtas
There is also a range of private health care services
Tá réimse de sheirbhísí príobháideacha cúraim sláinte ann freisin
Your permission to stay in Ireland may include a requirement that you have private health insurance
D'fhéadfaí go mbeadh sé riachtanach árachas sláinte príobháideach a bheith agat mar chuid den chead atá agat fanacht in Éirinn
Social security entitlements: If you are moving to Ireland you need to know about your social security entitlements
Teidlíochtaí slándála sóisialaí: Má tá tú ag teacht go hÉirinn, ní mór duit a bheith ar an eolas maidir le do theidlíochtaí slándála sóisialaí
EEA and Swiss nationals come under the general rules on social security for migrant workers
Clúdaítear náisiúnaigh an AE/LEE agus na hEilvéise faoi na rialacha ginearálta maidir le slándáil shóisialaigh d'oibrithe imirceacha

This means that you may receive certain benefits from your home country while you are in Ireland and you may combine social insurance contributions paid in 2 or more countries to help you qualify for benefits

I measc nithe eile, ciallaíonn seo go mb'fhéidir go bhfaighfeá sochair áirithe ó do thír dhúchais nuair a bheidh tú in Éirinn, agus is féidir leat ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh a n-íoctar iad in dhá thír nó níos mó a chur le chéile chun cabhrú leat a bheith incháilithe ar shochair
You are also entitled to the same social and tax advantages as Irish citizens
Ina theannta sin, tá tú i dteideal na mbuntáistí sóisialta agus cánach céanna is atá ag saoránaigh na hÉireann
There are bilateral social security arrangements with a small number of other countries
Tá comhaontuithe déthaobhacha maidir le slándáil shóisialta ann le líon beag de thíortha eile
These generally allow contributions in the other countries to be combined with your Irish contributions to enable you to qualify for benefits
Go hiondúil, ceadaíonn siad ranníocaíochtaí sna tíortha eile a chur le chéile le do ranníocaíochtaí in Éirinn le cur ar do chumas a bheith incháilithe ar shochair
Social assistance payments: Everyone, including Irish citizens, has to meet the habitual residence requirement if applying for a social assistance payment

Íocaíochtaí cúnaimh shóisialaigh: Ní mór do gach duine, saoránaigh na hÉireann san áireamh, an riachtanas maidir le gnáthchónaí a chomhlíonadh má tá siad ag cur isteach ar íocaíocht chúnaimh shóisialaigh
Changing your name: A foreign national aged 18 or over must get a change of name licence from the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS) before executing a deed poll

D'ainm a athrú: Caithfidh náisiúnach coigríche de 18 bliana d'aois nó os a chionn ceadúnas um athrú ainm ó Sheirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (INIS) sula gcuireann sé gníomhas aonpháirtí i bhfeidhm
A British citizen does not require a change of name licence but is likely to need a letter to that effect from INIS
Ní theastaíonn ceadúnas um athrú ainm ó shaoránach na Breataine, ach is dóigh go dteastóidh litir ó INIS uaidh chun é sin a dhearbhú
Pets: There are regulations about importing pets from abroad, so you need find out about the procedures for bringing your pet to Ireland
Peataí: Tá rialacháin ann maidir le peataí a thabhairt isteach anseo ó thír eile, mar sin ní mór duit a bheith ar an eolas faoi na nósanna imeachta chun do pheata a thabhairt go hÉirinn

Customs: There are customs regulations about the importation of prohibited or restricted goods and Customs and Excise officers have the power to carry out searches of the baggage of people travelling to Ireland
Custaim: Tá rialacháin chustaim ann maidir le hearraí coiscthe nó srianta a allmhairiú agus tá sé de chumhacht ag oifigigh Chustaim agus Mháil bagáiste daoine atá ag taisteal go hÉirinn a chuardach
Driving, cars and transport: Full driving licences from all other EU member states (and some other countries) are recognised for use in Ireland
Tiomáint, carranna agus iompar: Aithnítear ceadúnais tiomána iomlána ó gach stát eile san AE (agus ó roinnt tíortha eile) le húsáid in Éirinn
You should find out if you need to convert your driving licence to an Irish one
Ba cheart duit a fháil amach an mbeidh ort do cheadúnas tiomána a mhalartú ar son ceadúnais tiomána Éireannaigh
If you want to bring your car to Ireland you need to know about importing a car and implications for Vehicle Registration Tax (VRT)
Más mian leat do charr a thabhairt go hÉireann, ní mór duit a bheith ar an eolas faoi charr a iompórtáil agus faoi na himpleachtaí maidir le Cáin Chláraithe Feithicle (CCF)
You can get further information from your nearest Irish embassy or consulate or the embassy or consulate of your country in Ireland
Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil ón ambasáid nó ón gconsalacht Éireannach is cóngaraí nó ó ambasáid nó ó chonsalacht do thíre in Éirinn
